post: Looking for a reason to support the Bill of Rights Institute this Giving Tuesday? Your support helps provide free, high-quality resources to teachers and students across the country, empowering the next generation to engage with our nations history and strengthen their civic knowledge. Heres how you can give: Donate directly!  https://lnkd.in/eFMjmqq8 Federal employees and retirees can give through the Combined Federal Campaign using charity code 36265  https://lnkd.in/gqJpMgr Book your next trip through TravelingToGive, the smart trip-planning tool that turns your travel into support for civic education.  https://lnkd.in/epqqzbzz  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #GivingTuesday

The Bill of Rights Institute would like to thank Case Paper for their donation to the Power of the Printed Word. Justin Goldstein, CAE, Director of Corporate Relations, recently attended an event hosted by Case Paper in Philadelphia. The paper and paperboard merchant and converter was founded in 1943. For more information on Case Paper, visit their website here  https://casepaper.com/. Interested in learning more about the Power of the Printed Word? https://lnkd.in/eK6jcJau

Don't miss out! Enjoy 20% off storewide on all your favorite Bill of Rights Institute items. Teachers, this is your chance to stock up on classroom essentials! Shopping for a history or government teacher? Find the perfect gift while saving on classroom materials, t-shirts, stickers, and more. Use code BLACKFRIDAY at checkout to claim your discount. Shop now and dont miss these savings!  https://lnkd.in/euFBBmF8  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CivicEducation  #BlackFriday

Don't miss out our first-ever Black Friday Sale! Enjoy 20% off storewide from Nov 29-Dec 3rd. Teachers! Stock up on classroom favorites! Have a history or government teacher in your life? Shop now to save on classroom materials, t-shirts, stickers, and more! Use code: BLACKFRIDAY at check-out to receive the 20% off discount. Visit  https://lnkd.in/euFBBmF8 to shop!

Happy Thanksgiving from the Bill of Rights Institute! What is the significance of the First Thanksgiving? Listen to this 'Fabric of History' podcast episode to discover and appreciate the larger themes of what we commemorate as Thanksgiving today.  https://lnkd.in/eayp_22g

"Thanksgiving is almost here, and I hope you will spend the day surrounded by loved ones and reflecting on all we have to be thankful for as Americans." Read the letter from David J. Bobb, President and CEO of the Bill of Rights Institute, below.

The Bill of Rights Institute would like to thank Star Spangled Tea for their generous donation of teas at our 'Tea Party' last weekend at  #NCSS2024. Teachers who attended the breakfast enjoyed the brewed Georgia Peach Apricot Black Tea & basket giveaway. Star Spangled Tea specializes in an assortment of artisanal teas expertly sourced and regionally inspired by the great U. S. A. Interested in purchasing? When you shop using code 'BRI1791,' a portion of your purchase goes back to BRI. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eNRSQW2C to shop.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #StarSpangledTea  #tea

Did you know that the majority of our team at ActivateGenZ, including our Executive Director (and Founder!),Sam Underhill, and Editor-in-Chief, Cecelia Cullen, are proud alumni of the Bill of Rights Institute's Student Fellowship Program? 💡 The BRI fellowship was more than just an opportunity to explore civic engagement; it was a transformative experience that empowered us to lead, think critically, and make a tangible impact. The lessons we learnedabout leadership, constitutional principles, and the power of youth voicesare at the very core of what drives ActivateGenZ's mission today. To the Bill of Rights Internship, thank you for believing in us, inspiring us, and continuing to support the next generation of changemakers.

The Bill of Rights Institute was founded on the simple, powerful belief that all students should have access to a high-quality education in civics and history. 2024 marks the 25th anniversary of the founding of the Bill of Rights Institute. Read the article to see how BRI is celebrating a quarter-century of supporting educators and students in every corner of America.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #anniversary  #civicseducation

We would like to thank BNP Empowered Print and Quality Bindery Services, Inc. for their generous donation to the Bill of Rights Institute. Thousands of students in New York will now have pocket constitutions thanks to BNP and Quality Bindery Services. BNP Empowered Print is a full-service printing company based in Buffalo, NY, specializing in turn-key print solutions such as digital, web offset, and other printing capabilities. To learn more, visit  https://printbnp.com/ Quality Bindery Services Inc. is a comprehensive hardcover and softcover bookbinding shop for materials new and old. QBS is a full-service post-press finishing bindery for printers in Buffalo & Rochester, NY and Erie, PA. Learn more at  https://lnkd.in/eMU9KKnt Interested in donating? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eK6jcJau.

Calling all patriotic tea drinkers! The Bill of Rights Institute is proud to partner with companies like Star Spangled Tea. Star Spangled Tea offers signature American tea blends from a veteran-owned business. Specializing in an assortment of artisanal teas expertly sourced and regionally inspired by the great U. S. A. Interested in purchasing your favorite tea? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eNRSQW2C and use code ‘BRI1791' at checkout.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #StarSpangledTea  #Tea
